heading: 1.4 Solver settings
text:
mrgsolve uses DLSODA solver ODEPACK. Several settings
solver stored model object passed solver 
problem started. Settings include: atol, rtol, maxsteps, hmax,
hmin, ixpr, mxhnil.

heading: 1.4.1 atol
text:
Absolute tolerance parameter. Adjust value lower see state variables
(compartments) becoming small possibly turning negative. 
example:Adjusting atol 1E-20 1E-30 prevent .

heading: 1.4.2 rtol
text:
Relative tolerance parameter. Adjust value lower want 
precision around calculation state variables system advances.

heading: 1.6 Random effect variances
text:
mrgsolve model object keeps track arbitrary number block matrices
used simulate variates multivariate normal distributions.
Users can specify OMEGA matrices simulating -subject random effects
(one draw per individual) SIGMA matrices simulating within-subject
random effects (one draw per observation).user may use revar() function query OMEGA SIGMA.

heading: 2.1 How / where to write a model
text:
two ways write model:Code separate file source R scriptCode inline character string already R scriptWe recommend method 1 (separate file) non-trivial modeling work.
Method 2 handy quickly coding model ’ll also see us using
approach frequently demonstrating use mrgsolve.

heading: 2.1.1 Separate file
text:
Open text editor type model file name 
format <model-name>.cpp. filename format identifies “name” 
model (<model-name>, “stem” file name). extension MUST
.cpp (mrgsolve currently assumes extension). Note: whole file
read parsed, everything must valid mrgsolve model
specification elements.Use mread() function read parse file. model
called mymodel saved mymodel.cpp (current working directory),
issue command:mread() returns model object can simulate.
code: mod <- mread("mymodel")

text:

called code. name object irrelevant. code 
passed mrgsolve model definition. mrgsolve gets model
like along “name” model, mrgsolve write code 
file called <model-name>.cpp read right back typed
code file (section 2.1.1).parse load model, use mcode() command:mcode() convenience wrapper mread(). mcode writes code 
mymodel.cpp tempdir(), reads back , compiles loads.mcode call equivalent :help, see ?mread , ?mcode R help system loading
mrgsolve.
code:
code <- '
$PARAM CL = 1, VC = 20
$PKMODEL ncmt=1
'
mod <- mcode("mymodel", code)
mod <- mread("mymodel", tempdir(), code)

heading: 11.1 Annotated model specification
text:
complete annotated mrgsolve model. goal get several
common blocks might want annotate. different code
blocks rendered separately clarity presentation; users
include relevant blocks single file (R string).
code:
$PROB

# Final PK model

- Author: Pmetrics Scientist
- Client: Pharmaco, Inc.
- Date: `r Sys.Date()`
- NONMEM Run: 12345
- Structure: one compartment, first order absorption
- Implementation: closed form solutions
- Error model: Additive + proportional
- Covariates:
  - WT on clearance
- SEX on volume
- Random effects on: `CL`, `V`, `KA`[PARAM] @annotated
TVCL : 1.1   : Clearance (L/hr)
TVV  : 35.6  : Volume of distribution (L)
TVKA : 1.35  : Absorption rate constant (1/hr)
WT   : 70    : Weight (kg)
SEX  : 1     : Male = 0, Female 1
WTCL : 0.75  : Exponent weight on CL
SEXV : 0.878 : Volume female/Volume male[MAIN]
double CL = TVCL*pow(WT/70,WTCL)*exp(ECL);
double V  = TVV *pow(SEXVC,SEX)*exp(EV);
double KA = TVKA*exp(EKA);[OMEGA] @name OMGA @correlation @block
ECL : 1.23 : Random effect on CL
EV  : 0.67 0.4 : Random effect on V
EKA : 0.25 0.87 0.2 : Random effect on KA[SIGMA] @name SGMA 
PROP: 0.25 : Proportional residual error
ADD : 25   : Additive residual error[CMT]
GUT  : Dosing compartment  (mg)
CENT : Central compartment (mg)[PKMODEL] ncmt = 1, depot=TRUE[TABLE]
capture IPRED = CENT/V;
double DV = IPRED*(1+PROP) + ADD;[CAPTURE]
DV  : Concentration (mg/L)
ECL : Random effect on CL
CL  : Individual clearance (L/hr)

heading: 11.7 Resimulate ETA and EPS
text:
Call simeps(n) resimulate ETANo $PLUGIN requiredsimeta(n) takes single argument (n), ETA number resimulateFor example, can simulate individual-level covariates
within certain range:Call simeps(n) resimulate EPSNo $PLUGIN requiredsimeps() takes single argument (n), EPS number resimulateFor example, can resimulate 
concentrations greater zero:safety check recommended
Note examples, implement safety check: integer counter 
incremented every time resimulated. resimulation process stops 
don’t reach desired condition within 100 replicates. might also
consider issuing message flag simulated data able
reach desired condition.
code:
code <- '
$PARAM TVCL = 1, TVWT = 70

$MAIN 
capture WT = TVWT*exp(EWT);

int i = 0;

while((WT < 60) || (WT > 80)) {
  if(++i > 100) break;
  simeta(1);
  WT = TVWT*exp(EWT);
}

$OMEGA @labels EWT
4

$CAPTURE EWT WT
'

mod <- mcode("simeta", code)

out <- mod %>% mrgsim(nid=100, end=-1)
